attributes.action: Disallow chlorinated chicken being allowed to enter UK food markets and shops.
attributes.additional_details:
Health Concerns:
Chlorine washing treats chicken carcasses with chlorine-based solutions (e.g., chlorine dioxide or hypochlorous acid) to kill surface bacteria like Salmonella:Campylobacter. This masks deeper hygiene issues in the production chain.  A 2018 Southampton University study found that pathogens can survive chlorine washes.  The process might obscure systemic flaws where bacteria thrive. 

Welfare Concerns:
The bigger issue is what chlorination enables: lower animal welfare standards.
attributes.background: We call on the UK Government to enact legislation banning the import of chlorinated chicken from any country to protect UK food safety and animal welfare standards.

rejection.details:
The Minister for Trade Policy and Economic Security, Douglas Alexander MP gave a statement on trade negotiations in the House of Commons Chamber on 8 May stating "the import of hormone-treated beef or chlorinated chicken will remain illegal". You can read the full transcript in Hansard: 
https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2025-05-08/debates/BBFBC52E-FBD4-466A-A0D1-5A745E53B564/TradeNegotiations
